body: @skarakulak just checked it out and I can confirm that I'm seeing the same issue. I'll mess around with this for a while and update soon. Thanks for the bug report!
@skarakulak Looks like there is a `TopologicalError` thrown by one of the geometries and it silently causes the tile processing section to fail. I'll add some handling for that to fix this
Thanks a lot for the quick response, much appreciated

I have tried with the latest code but still getting no labels:

```
serkan@serkan-HP-ubuntu:~/temp_geo$ label-maker labels
Determining labels for each tile
TopologyException: Input geom 0 is invalid: Self-intersection at or near point 9 247 at 9 247
---
Landuse: 0 tiles
Roads: 0 tiles
Building: 0 tiles
Total tiles: 4
Writing out labels to data/labels.npz
serkan@serkan-HP-ubuntu:~/temp_geo$ label-maker images
Downloading 0 tiles to data/tiles

```

@skarakulak it still isn't merged in yet. If you want to try it out now, you can install directly from the repo (`pip install -e .`) on the branch `bug/118-skip-bad-geometries`. Otherwise, we'll have a new release early next week

I got same problem.
```
TopologyException: Input geom 0 is invalid: Self-intersection at or near point 226 179 at 226 179
```
Analogical errors appear with other bounding boxes.
Is this bug or my mistake?

I tried the example from [devseed.com](http://devseed.com/label-maker/) and got same:
`TopologyException: Input geom 0 is invalid: Self-intersection at or near point 216 84 at 216 84
The operation 'GEOSIntersection_r' could not be performed. Likely cause is invalidity of the geometry <shapely.geometry.polygon.Polygon object at 0x7fe07347d898> skipping`
What's the problem?

@NickElixir, check your (multi)polygon/geometry, when it was created, some bow-tie/intersect was accidentally created. Check this - [How to fix invalid polygon with self-intersection - Python ](https://gis.stackexchange.com/questions/311209/how-to-fix-invalid-polygon-with-self-intersection-python).
@Geoyi, I don't understand what I should do. This is my bounding box: `[1.09725, 6.05520, 1.34582, 6.30915]` for togo

Hey Nick,
It's been a while and I don't remember how I solved that particular issue.
However I made some changes with the label-maker which worked for me in the
end. Perhaps you might wanna go through the commits here
https://github.com/skarakulak/label-maker

Also you can clone the fork and try to get the data with your bounding box
with this modified version. My solution was kind of a quick hack, and it
changed the default behavior of label-maker which might result in undesired
behavior in other tasks other than segmentation. So I didn't open a PR for
it.

Sorry for not being more helpful. Let me know if this doesn't solve the
problem or if you have any questions regarding the changes that I have made
in the fork.

Best,
Serkan

@skarakulak I use Colab for downloading images for segmentation. How I can install your fork in Colab?

@NickElixir @skarakulak @Geoyi the problematic geometries sometimes come directly from OSM or when they get chopped up by our tiling. It will show the warning but skips the geometry and should continue from there.

@NickElixir are you still getting results after seeing that warning?
